summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and the inmate to whom discovery materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The signatory of the letter, transmitting discovery on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: AJN
persons.context: The judge assigned to the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330), referenced by initials in the case caption.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Criminal Case Against Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ongoing federal criminal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell under docket number 20 Cr. 330.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building (One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007)
Metropolitan Detention Center (80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of December 2020.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, led by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, was prosecuting Maxwell under case number 20 Cr. 330.
This document is a cover letter transmitting discovery materials to Maxwell in her criminal case.
The document confirms the ongoing legal proceedings against Maxwell in late 2020.
